intro: Schnella stuebeliana, commonly known as the Stuebel's Schnella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schnella stuebeliana is considered a species of conservation concern.
